text: The AAA 400 Drive for Autism is a Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series race held annually at Dover International Speedway, it is one of two races on the circuit, with the other one being the Dover 400 in October, The race is the 11th race of the season and AAA became the title sponsor for 2016. NASCAR had memorable finishes at this racetrack. The race reduced from 500 miles to 400 miles in 1998. == Past winners == Year Date Car # Driver Team Manufacturer Laps Miles 1969 July 6 43 Richard Petty Petty Enterprises Ford 300 1970 Sept. 30 43 Richard Petty Petty Enterprises Plymouth 300 1971 June 6 12 Bobby Allison Holman-Moody Mercury 500 1972 June 4 12 Bobby Allison Richard Howard Chevrolet 500 1973 June 3 21 David Pearson Wood Brothers Racing Mercury 500 1974 May 19 11 Cale Yarborough Richard Howard Chevrolet 450* 1975 May 18 21 David Pearson Wood Brothers Racing Mercury 500 1976 May 16 72 Benny Parsons L.G.
